Finding your Escapees Club Membership Card
Having access to your Escapees Club Membership Card is important.  It will provide your SKP Membership Number as well as the Expiration.  This is how to prove your membership is ACTIVE.
These instructions will display your membership card and allow you to view all the benefits provided with the membership.  After displaying your card, we recommend you enable AUTO RENEWAL.
After
logging into your Escapees Club account
on
Escapees.com
, open the menu.
On a PC, the menu button is in the upper right corner with your name highlighted.
On a smartphone, the menu button is in the lower right corner.
Once the menu comes up, press (My) MEMBERSHIP to display your personalized membership card and membership details.  If there are any issues with what is shown, use the information
here to contact
the Escapees Club.  The kind people at the Florida SKP Resort will not have all the answers.
While on this page, turn on auto-renewal. The Billing Information may need to be updated first.
Finding your Escapees Club Membership Card
Having access to your Escapees Club Membership Card is important.  It will provide your SKP Membership Number as well as the Expiration.  This is how to prove your membership is ACTIVE.
These instructions will display your membership card and allow you to view all the benefits provided with the membership.  After displaying your card, we recommend you enable AUTO RENEWAL.
After
logging into your Escapees Club account
on
Escapees.com
, open the menu.
On a PC, the menu button is in the upper right corner with your name highlighted.
On a smartphone, the menu button is in the lower right corner.
Once the menu comes up, press (My) MEMBERSHIP to display your personalized membership card and membership details.  If there are any issues with what is shown, use the information
here to contact
the Escapees Club.  The kind people at the Florida SKP Resort will not have all the answers.
While on this page, turn on auto-renewal. The Billing Information may need to be updated first.

Contacting Escapees Club
If you have a question about your
Escapees Club
membership, call (833) 224-6267 Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm Eastern
THE BEST way to contact is by email
clubbusiness@escapees.com
.
If you need to renew, ask them to call back so they can take your payment information.
THE PREFERRED RENEWAL PROCESS IS ONLINE.  You can flag your online Escapees Club account for automatic renewal.  The system will correspond automatically via e-mail.
If you want to mail in a check, your account will be updated once it’s received, and a receipt can be sent via email but not by USPS.
If a check for renewal is being mailed, send it to :
Escapees Mail Service
Attn: Club Membership Renewal
100 Rainbow Dr.
Livingston, TX 77399
Provide your name, SKP #, phone number, and email address in all correspondence.
Take a photo of the letter with the check for your records.
There is also a very helpful tool available on the
Escapees.com
page.  Click the little bubble in the lower right-hand corner to get assistance 24 hours a day.  If an agent is not online, the data robot HARVEY may have what is needed.
Contacting Escapees Club

If you want to mail in a check, your account will be updated once it’s received, and a receipt can be sent via email but not by USPS.

Attn: Club Membership Renewal
100 Rainbow Dr.
Livingston, TX 77399
Provide your name, SKP #, phone number, and email address in all correspondence.
Take a photo of the letter with the check for your records.

Escapees.com
page.  Click the little bubble in the lower right-hand corner to get assistance 24 hours a day.  If an agent is not online, the data robot HARVEY may have what is needed.

Pathway To Membership
Thank you for your interest in the Florida SKP Resort, a 55+ community. We recommend that anyone looking for membership in our or community plan a visit with us.
This resort was built by the members and has been maintained by its members and visitors, ever since.  We want you to experience the vibrant community we are today so you can make an informed decision about becoming members.
New members and repeat visits from those on the wait list bring fresh perspectives, new ideas and energy to the park! We are very proud of our park and facilities. Even though we are called a “resort,” we are really a membership park where we all work together to maintain and run “our” park. We would like you to think of this park as your home and help take care of it as you would your own property.
Come visit; talk with members and visitors.  Participate in the life of our community and get a feel for our park. Feel the warmth of the sunshine on your back and cool off at our beautiful outdoor pool.
As in any other place, life is what you make it. We believe that our lives are enriched and healthier by living here because the occasions for social interaction are limitless. There is always something going on including a variety of special interest activities, breakfasts, social hours, movie nights, cards and games, informal get-togethers, dinners, sightseeing, as well as shows and shopping in surrounding communities to name just a few.
The members of the park are active citizens of the community with many volunteering at the local hospital, churches, and non-profit organizations, i.e. participating in the county’s annual Christmas parade, volunteering as bell ringers for the Salvation Army, and donating blood. Studies show that people who volunteer and participate in social events 1 to 2 hours a week are healthier, live longer, and are more satisfied with their lives.
If you like what you see here, you will be ready to begin the pathway to membership that is outlined on “
Interested in Membership?
” page.
What can you expect from your life at the FL SKP Resort?
An active volunteer base is necessary for our park to be successful. Our park was built by and is maintained by volunteers. As a member, your involvement is expected. Committees are the main support system of our governing body and members are always needed to serve on these committees. Any talent or skill can be used and will help fill a need in the park. This park was built on the talents and efforts of many willing hands. Yours are needed too.
As in any other place, life is what you make it. We believe that our lives are enriched and healthier by living here. The occasions for social interaction are limitless. There is always something going on including a variety of special interest activities, breakfasts, social hours, movie nights, cards and games, informal get-togethers, dinners, sightseeing, shows, and shopping in surrounding communities to name just a few.
The members of the park are active citizens of the community with many volunteering at local hospitals and churches. We participate in the local Chamber of Commerce, march in the Christmas parade, volunteer as bell ringers for the Salvation Army, and donate blood, examples of additional volunteer opportunities. According to AARP, studies show that people who volunteer 1 to 2 hours a week are healthier, live longer and are more satisfied with their lives, compared with non-volunteers.
Some of our requirements
Be an Escapee RV Club member in good standing.
Be 55 years of age at the time your membership becomes available.
As the FL SKP Resort was built by RVers for RVers, we believe that owning an RV and actively experiencing the RV lifestyle is an important step in becoming a member. At the time your membership becomes available you should be living or traveling in an RV.
Read the
Wait List Rules
.
If you decide that membership in the Florida SKP Resort would enhance your life and that your presence and participation at the Resort will better our community, we invite you to pursue membership by requesting an application from the
Wait List Committee
(waitlist@fl-skp-resort.org).
